lexUnit.name: hook.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to attach or join together by means of a hook

sentence.text: Using a claw weight and a magnet , hook the weight in the knitting where you wish to join in a new colour and sandwich the end of the wool between the claw , weight and the magnet .
Kelly hooked her thumbs in the tops of her pants .
The Guardia Nacional wear jackboots and hook their fingers in their trigger guards .
With a flourish he drew a line at the bottom , screwed on the top of his fountain pen and hooked it into a buckle on his braces .
He hooked a finger into the corner of his mouth , as though he was versifying on the spot .
Finally he hooks his belt onto the Doom Diver Catapult and braces himself for sudden acceleration .
There is no room for a chair , so I crouch between the willows and hook a plummet onto the size 18 hook .
Then , almost so certain as to be positive that he could not abide a clinging type of woman , she hooked her arm through his .
Taking one hand off the wheel , Nathan reached out and hooked his fingers through the front of her harness .
I 'm certain he 'd hooked his umbrella through the handles of the handbag and pulled it out , right under our very eyes .
Nat turned and shouted this garbled message to me and I hooked my dogs to a tree and went forward to talk to him .
Omi hooked a thread around her crochet-hook .
Hrun heaved , and managed to hook his fingers under the stone .
Returning thoughtfully to his own back bedroom , he tuned one of his receivers to the frequency he had read off the antenna and hooked it up to a tape machine .
The lamp could be hooked onto the front of a miner 's cap or hung on a wooden roof support while he was working .
Matilda pulled up the rope and hooked the handle of the bucket on to the end of it .
